articles.description: A thumping 3-0 loss and no shots on target - how, after more than £1.5bn spent, have Chelsea ended up with no centre-forward?
articles.title: Brighton 3-0 Chelsea: How did Chelsea end up with no fit strikers?

articles.description: Everton, Liverpool and Arne Slot are charged by the Football Association after incidents at the end of Wednesday's Merseyside derby at Goodison Park.
articles.title: Everton, Liverpool and Arne Slot charged after Merseyside derby melee

articles.description: The Premier League's rules governing sponsorship deals from the period between between 2021 and 2024 are "void and unenforceable", a tribunal rules.
articles.title: Premier League sponsorship rules 'void' says tribunal

articles.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.
articles.title: Daniel Levy protests: Would chairman ever leave Spurs amid fan protests?

articles.description: Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce says he is considering retirement from the NFL, but is yet to decide on his future.
articles.title: Travis Kelce: Kansas City Chiefs star considering NFL retirement after Super Bowl loss

articles.description: Follow live text commentary, score updates and match stats from Brighton & Hove Albion vs Chelsea in the Premier League
articles.title: Brighton vs Chelsea LIVE: Premier League score, stats, radio & updates

articles.description: The inside story of Jamal Musiala's historic new contract at Bayern Munich, which ties down one of the most exciting midfielders in the world.
articles.title: Jamal Musiala: Germany international signs historic lucrative contract extension at Bayern Munich

articles.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says the club will have to sell players if they are to buy anyone in the summer.
articles.title: Ruben Amorim: Manchester United must sell to buy this summer, says boss

articles.description: Australia are thrashed by 174 runs by Sri Lanka in their final one-day international before their Champions Trophy opener against England.
articles.title: Australia thrashed by Sri Lanka in final match before Champions Trophy

articles.description: Egyptian fencer Nada Hafez says it is important to tell women "your body can surprise you" after competing at the Paris Olympics while seven months pregnant.
articles.title: Nada Hafez: The Egyptian fencer's Olympic pregnancy which stunned the world
